title: POLITICO’s Working Group: Tackling deforestation: does the EU need to legislate?
text:
We are delighted to present POLITICO’s Working Group: “Tackling deforestation: does the EU need to legislate?”, taking place on October 15 in Brussels.

Organized in partnership with Cargill, this exclusive, invitation-only working group will bring together thought leaders and specialists for an in-depth conversation on the importance of tackling deforestation and the crucial role the EU will take in shaping an appropriate framework for competitive and sustainable solutions.

This solution-driven session, will be conducted according to the Chatham House rule. The conversation will be led by Arthur Neslen, senior agriculture and food reporter at POLITICO, and will feed into an editorial story.

Confirmed participants

Justin Adams, Executive Director, Tropical Forest Alliance João Henrique Bayão , Responsible for the Environmental Sector, Mission of Brazil to the EU. Mirko de Ponti , Coordinating Policy Advisor on Climate, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands Ignacio Gavilan , Environmental Sustainability Director, Consumers Goods Forum Thaís Linhares-Juvenal , Team Leader Forest Governance and Economics, Forestry, Policy and Resources Division – FAO (Forestry Department) Maike Moellers , Deputy Program Director, Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) Hannah Mowat , Campaigns Coordinator, FERN Hugo-Maria Schally , Head of Unit – Multilateral Environmental Cooperation, DG Environment, European Commission Charles O’Malley , Head of private sector partnerships, UNDP Green Commodities Programme Nils Torvalds MEP, RE-Coordinator in the ENVI Committee (Sweden), European Parliament



Opening remarks by Marta Zuluaga Zilbermann, Director Policy & Government Relations, Cargill

For more information, please contact us by email at events@politico.eu. This event is not public.
